title: Social Media Content Intern
description:
🧘 What we offer

  • A great team to learn from and collaborate with, in a fully remote, work-from-anywhere environment 🌏
  • A fully paid 3-month summer internship with the opportunity to learn, grow, and make an impact

🚀 We look forward to hearing from you!

SafetyWing (YC W18) is seeking a Social Media Content Intern to join us for Summer 2025.

At SafetyWing, we’re building a global social safety net for remote workers—simple health, insurance, and retirement products designed to replace national welfare systems. Our mission is to remove geographical borders as a barrier to equal opportunity and freedom for everyone. If we succeed, we believe this will be one of the most important tasks of our time.

👩‍💻 About this role

As a Social Media Content Intern, you’ll help drive the growth of SafetyWing’s presence on platforms like YouTube and Instagram by supporting our in-house video production efforts. Your work will focus on creating tools and templates for short-form content, optimizing for SEO, leveraging AI editing tools, and exploring new opportunities such as TikTok and original video series. 


💻 Your responsibilities will include

  • Building editing templates for Shorts, Reels, and other mobile-first content (hooks, captions, transitions), with an emphasis on experimenting with short-form hooks and trends
  • Editing and publishing short-form clips from Nomad Chats and other brand series
  • Optimizing YouTube SEO (titles, descriptions, tags, playlists) to enhance discoverability
  • Using AI tools to streamline and accelerate editing workflows
  • Exploring TikTok as a potential growth channel (content fit, audience opportunities), if aligned with interest and team priorities
  • Proposing a new short-form content series idea aligned with our brand for YouTube, Instagram, or TikTok

🧪 We are looking for someone who

  • Is committed to dedicating 3 months to this internship, full time, with an anticipated start date of June 2, 2025.
  • Is entrepreneurial and self-driven
  • Has a basic understanding of social media marketing; majoring in marketing or a similar field is a plus but not required

😀 We like to work with people who

  • Want to help build a global social safety net on the Internet
  • Think for themselves instead of copying others
  • Are willing to try new things, even with the risk of failure
  • Are intellectually curious and open to new ideas
  • Are creative and bold in the face of any problems
  • Have strong integrity and do the right thing

title: Principal Engineering Manager – Core Services
description:
[ABOUT ISTARI DIGITAL]
Istari is a digital engineering software company enabling our customers to turn the physical world into the digital to accomplish their specific mission or business objectives.

Istari was founded with the vision of making open, scalable digital engineering ecosystems a reality – where new technologies and systems are created digitally, free from the real-world constraints of costs and schedules. We are creating the world’s best engineering model sharing platform, allowing our customers to simply and securely integrate their models across different engineering disciplines, organizations, and security levels.

At Istari, we are passionate about our mission of creating the world's first open and scalable industrial metaverse. Whether our customers are designing prototypes, performing virtual testing, or training AI and autonomy for complex systems, we know that going digital will save them time, resources, and reduce their environmental impact.  

While we are a distributed team with most team-members working remotely, we place an emphasis on staying connected and collaborative, prioritizing in-person opportunities to build trust as a team. At Istari, we still believe that trust is best built in-person. To do this, we have an engineering headquarters in Cambridge, MA for focused technical development and several times per year we gather for an off-site that allows us to develop our professional skills and our team relationships.

[VALUES]
At Istari, we live by our values, which include:

Purposeful Autonomy
We value letting people self-organize and self-motivate. 
Our flat structure and lack of meeting clutter are meant to empower individuals and teams to be proactive.
Our autonomy is measured, goal-oriented, and results-driven – not meandering.
Clear objectives help us prioritize our time.

Smart Transparency
We believe in honest-but-kind communication, transparency, and open-door policies.
We love learning about challenges and tackling them early, not hearing good or bad news late.
We share work-in-progress across our team. 
Fast feedback keeps autonomy purposeful.

Continual Curiosity
At Istari, we love learning to do things ourselves.
We ask, read, share, teach – even watch YouTube videos – to learn new skills to solve problems.
When we make breakthroughs, we write them down.   
Writing focuses ideas, helps us learn, and helps us share.

Equal Opportunity
Istari is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran status, or disability status.


We are seeking an experienced Principal Engineering Manager to lead our Core Services team — the engineers building the foundational backend services that power our self-hosted platform.
We are seeking an experienced Principal Engineering Manager to lead our Core Services team — the engineers building the foundational backend services that power our self-hosted platform.

Key Responsibilities

  • Lead, Mentor & Grow: Manage and empower a high-performing team of Python engineers focused on developing and maintaining core backend systems.
  • Technical Guidance: Drive the architecture and technical strategy for building scalable, reliable, and maintainable services.
  • Cross-Team Collaboration: Work closely with Product, Platform, and Infrastructure teams to align priorities, synchronize on the roadmap, and ensure timely, high-quality deliveries.
  • Release Ownership: Oversee the end-to-end release process and operational support for core services—especially for our self-hosted deployments.
  • Quality & Reliability: Ensure systems meet the highest standards of performance, reliability, and customer integration needs, with particular focus on model servicing and critical backend workflows.
  • Continuous Improvement: Identify opportunities for process improvements, automation, and adoption of best practices in DevOps and service delivery.

    • Required Qualifications

  • Leadership Experience: Proven track record of successfully managing, mentoring, and scaling backend engineering teams, ideally in fast-paced and distributed environments.
  • Technical Expertise: Exceptional proficiency in Python and a thorough understanding of modern backend and service-oriented architectures.
  • Platform Delivery: Experience overseeing self-hosted or hybrid (on-prem/cloud) software delivery, including robust release and support pipelines.
  • Collaboration: Strong cross-functional communication skills with the ability to drive alignment and influence across engineering, product, and operations.
  • Operational Ownership: Familiarity with monitoring, deployment, and operational support within production environments.

    • Preferred Qualifications

  • Experience with containerization technologies such as Docker and Kubernetes
  • Expertise in implementing and maintaining CI/CD pipelines
  • Familiarity with observability, logging, and performance monitoring tools
    • BENEFITS
    We offer highly competitive benefits, including:

    Health and Family
    - Medical/Dental/Vision
    - Employee Premiums are 100% Company Paid
    - Life Insurance
    - Flexible Work Hours 
    - Unlimited Paid Time Off (PTO) with federal government holidays

    Financial
    - Competitive Compensation 
    - 401k 
    - Company Stock Options
    - Home Office Setup Budget

    Learning
    - Reimbursement for approved trainings and subscriptions
    - Conferences (travel, lodging, and fees)

    Note - some benefits are not available to interns or contractors.

    Thank you for your interest in Istari. Expect to hear back from us soon with next steps.

title: Senior Social Media Marketer
Staff Product Designer, Developer Experience
description:
While LiveKit operates as an infrastructure company, we believe that every detail matters—from backend to frontend, from a single line of code to a single pixel. Design is not just how it looks, but how all the pieces work and fit together — from a developer landing on our homepage to connecting and interacting with our APIs for the first time.

We’re looking for a Product Designer to join our team. The ideal candidate has experience designing developer tools focused on observability and monitoring, and is excited about the future of realtime voice, video, and AI.

What you’ll do

  • Collaborate with a cross functional team to design high quality end-to-end features that can ship quickly.

  • Generate insights from customer feedback and stakeholders to design best in class solutions to complex problems.

  • Design scalable, responsive, and accessible interfaces and interactions while contributing to our design system.

  • Continuously and proactively identify and prioritize areas of improvement in our products through a design lens.

  • Collaborate with other designers to level up design across all of LiveKit.

  • Make things ✨.

Who you are

  • 8+ years of experience designing developer-centered or technical products.

  • Your portfolio showcases the design of complex products (such as developer tooling) with a high degree of craft and polish.

  • Collaborative spirit who enjoys working with developers, designers, and stakeholders from the start to finish of projects.

  • Ability to shape the vision for larger initiatives but can also scope design solutions for fast product iteration.

  • Strong grasp of responsive and accessible design principles, ensuring interfaces work well across devices and meet usability standards for all users.

  • Effective communicator with a strong design point of view while also being open and welcoming feedback from team members and stakeholders.

  • Proficiency with Figma + other tools that help you do your best work.

  • Experience designing for OSS, developer tooling, or similar fields.

Bonus

  • Experience designing for highly visual and technical dashboards.

  • Familiarity with coding (HTML, CSS, JavaScript) and frameworks like React and Tailwind.

Our Commitments to You

We offer

  • An opportunity to build something truly impactful to the world

  • Competitive salary and equity package

  • Work anywhere in the world

  • Health, dental, and vision benefits

  • Flexible vacation policy

title: People Experience Specialist
description:
EMPOWER OVERVIEW

Empower is shaking up an outdated financial system by providing real opportunity for our customers: the opportunity to get the cash they need, to access fair credit, and to change their financial story. Today, we’re helping millions of people find financial security through machine learning models that evaluate creditworthiness using a more inclusive lens and mobile-first products: Cash Advance, Thrive line of credit, and Petal credit cards. Tomorrow? Creating even more financial paths for our customers (and their wallets) to succeed.

This year, Empower ranked #65 on Inc. 5000’s Fastest-Growing Private Companies list — our third year in a row cracking the top 100 — and was named by Forbes as one of the 25 Next Billion-Dollar Startups for 2024. Empower was also featured by Forbes on America’s Best Startup Employers list in 2023, and our Thrive line of credit product was named by Fast Company as one of 2022’s Next Big Things in Tech.

Empower is backed by Sequoia Capital, Blisce, and Icon Ventures. Ready to grow your impact and accelerate your career? Take a look at our open roles — we can’t wait to meet you.

The Opportunity: People Experience Specialist

Empower’s mission is powered by a virtual-first team from around the world. As a People Experience Specialist, your mission is to accelerate the learning and performance of our global team: making it easier for our employees to onboard, build relationships, find answers, and get things done. This role focuses on unlocking our team’s potential using moments that matter throughout the employee journey:

  • Kickstarting learning and team integration through onboarding experiences that set our teams up for success from day one

  • Breaking down siloes and strengthening global relationships through our semiannual company on-sites

  • Connecting employees to live and asynchronous information and tools they need to get the job done

You'll be the connector who ensures everyone has what they need to hit the ground running, from their first day on the job to when their planes land for our semiannual global on-sites. By thoughtfully designing for the employee experience, you'll help build a workplace where employees stay informed, connected, and equipped to do their best work.

How You'll Make an Impact

  • Deliver Incredible Experiences (50%): Orchestrate authentic IRL events that bring our teams closer together and advance our mission (with plenty of fun and outdoor activities!)

  • Accelerate Learning (20%): Design and implement a seamless onboarding experience that gets new hires up to speed and feeling connected from day one

  • Communicate at Scale (10%): Craft compelling internal communications and collateral that keep team members around the world in the loop without drowning in corporate speak

  • Develop Scalable Resources (10%): Launch, curate, and maintain organizational data, content, and programs that drive employee success and leverage AI effectively

  • Connect the Dots (10%): Identify and address needs throughout the employee lifecycle to ensure our team operates efficiently and our culture scales consistently as we grow

Why You're a Great Fit

  • You’re a quick study: you love figuring out how an organization works, and helping others do the same

  • You love the details: you sweat the “small stuff” in order to have big impact

  • You see around corners: you can think a couple steps ahead to anticipate others’ needs

  • You know what “great” looks like: you’ve planned or supported global events with 150+ attendees for at least 2 years

  • You are resourceful: you know when to build, when to buy, when to use AI, and when to go without when investing in our team

Your experience likely includes:

  • A degree in Business, Management, Human Resources, Communications, or a similar field

  • 1-4 years of experience in HR, employee experience, communications, or event planning roles

  • Strong communication skills with the ability to craft messages that resonate across different channels and audiences

  • Exceptionally strong problem solving and project management skills; you thrive when you’re organizing chaos, untangling a mess, and juggling multiple priorities

  • Eagerness to learn new tools and workplace systems, including Rippling, Ashby, Linear or other project management tools, and emerging resources powered by AI

Don't meet every qualification? If you're excited about this challenge and driven to innovate, we still want to hear from you!

What You'll Get at Empower

  • Meaningful Ownership: Competitive salary and generous equity in a profitable, fast growing company.

  • Complete Support: 100% coverage for medical, dental, vision, and life insurance, plus a generous WFH reimbursement.

  • High-Impact Teams: The chance to thrive in a small, focused team where your contributions directly shape outcomes for our business and customers.

  • Remote First: A virtual first environment built on trust and outcomes.

  • Team Connection: Twice-yearly company onsites where we come together to connect, learn, and build for the future (our last few have been in San Diego, Vail, and Flagstaff)!

  • Growth Path: Ongoing opportunities for development in a dynamic, supportive, and creative environment.

The Empower Way

The Empower Way is one where bold ambition meets an owner mindset, where open dialogue and spirited debate are encouraged, and where everyone works together to put our customers first. We believe diverse voices lead to the best ideas, and we foster an environment where every individual is valued, heard, and supported as part of one unified team working to change lives and build a more inclusive future.

If that sounds like you, join us and be part of a team that's helping millions of people reshape their financial futures.

title: Enterprise Customer Success Manager
Growth Leader
description:
Want to lead growth for a product already trusted by 250,000+ users?

We’re building new SaaS platforms for Software Localization AI Translation and looking for someone to take full ownership of our content and partnerships strategy—from idea to execution.

You’ll have the freedom to define the direction, test what works, and double down on what delivers results. No templates. No hand-holding. Just real work with real impact.

Must-Have
  • Deep curiosity about human psychology and what drives action
  • Excellent writing, editing, and critical thinking
  • Excited by the opportunity to sell, not just to write
  • Clear, concise communicator who gets the message across
  • Comfortable leading a small creative team (writers, designers, devs)
  • Willing to take full responsibility—when things go right and when they don’t
Nice-to-Have
  • Experience with WordPress and content-driven growth
  • Experience managing partnerships or affiliates
  • Exposure to SEO and/or paid campaigns
  • Comfort working with remote, async teams
What You’ll Do
  • Lead our content and partnership strategy end to end
  • Collaborate with writers, designers, and developers to launch and test growth ideas
  • Talk to clients to understand real needs—and turn those into marketing that resonates
  • Work fast, learn fast, and adjust based on results
  • Make tradeoffs between speed, budget, and quality—and be transparent about them
About Us

We’re OnTheGoSystems, a fully remote company behind WPML, Toolset, and now PTC—our new SaaS product building the world’s better-than-human translation technology.

We’re not a startup, but we act like one: lean, fast, and focused on outcomes.

What We Offer
  • 100% remote work, async-friendly
  • BAMM program to support hobbies and movement
  • Budget for your workspace and gear
  • Kindle + access to our company Amazon account for unlimited reading
  • National holidays are respected wherever you live
  • Smart, driven colleagues around the world
  • Clear opportunity for growth and ownership
How to Apply

We want to know how you think and act. If you’re the kind of person who makes things happen, we want to hear from you – apply now.
